|cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 |cpu1spd = 800 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Samsung;K9F1G08U0D-SCB0; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4B1G1646G-BCH9; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 218BN, 1219 MY;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = U12H240 |manuf_rev = T99 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, Tomato (Shibby), |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 03/26/2013 |estreldate = 06/28/2013 |estprice = |upc = 606449096538 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B00DR7EG0I |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam1 = |rad1ac = 975 |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== {{WiFiCert|WFA19989|07/02/2013}} *OEM: [[Foxconn]] ([[Ambit]]) [https://github.com/mirror/dd-wrt/blob/master/src/router/netgear/ambitCfg-ac1450.h U12H240T99] ==Specifications== Information, per ''Netgear'''s product page, follows... *''Netgear'' specifies the processor in this device as being :dual-core and clocked at 800MHz. *The 11ac radio is limited to a maximum 975Mbps PHY rate.. *The device has two USB ports (1x USB 3.0, 1x USB 2.0). *The device has Tx Beamforming support. The FCC photos for this device show space for a single RAM chip.. :which is a [[Samsung]] K4B1G1646G (128MB) in those photos. :However, [http://www.netgear.nl/images/AC1450_DS_18Apr1386-75151.pdf ''Netgear'''s datasheet for the device] notes :the device as having 256MB of RAM.. The Netgear AC1450 hardware is identical to the [[Netgear R6300 v2]]. :It is possible to convert this model to a R6300 v2 with a little effort. ==Links of Interest== *[http://web.archive.org/web/20191020234411/https://advancedhomeserver.com/upgrade-a-netgear-ac1450-router-to-ac1750-r6300v2/ ''Upgrade a AC1450 to AC1750 (R6300v2)'' on '''Advanced Home Server'''] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/32126-netgear-tries-ac1450-on-for-size%20announcement ''Netgear tries AC1450 on for size'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] (announcement) ===Firmware Development=== *Supported by DD-WRT: [ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/betas/2015/05-09-2015-r26866/netgear-ac1450/ ''Netgear AC1450 FW r26866 beta''] *Supported by Tomato: [http://tomato.groov.pl/download/K26ARM/129/tomato-R6300v2-ARM--129-AIO-64K.zip ARM-129-AIO-64K] â€¢ [http://tomato.groov.pl/download/K26ARM/129/tomato-R6300v2-ARM--129-VPN-64K.zip ARM-129-VPN-64K] Testers with de-bricking knowledge needed for Tomato builds [https://bitbucket.org/qinyq contact] ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====GPIO==== 
/* GPIO definitions */
#define GPIO_POWER_LED_GREEN        2
#define GPIO_POWER_LED_GREEN_STR    "2"
#define GPIO_POWER_LED_AMBER        3
#define GPIO_POWER_LED_AMBER_STR    "3"

#define GPIO_LOGO_LED_1             1
#define GPIO_LOGO_LED_1_STR         "1"
#define GPIO_LOGO_LED_2             9
#define GPIO_LOGO_LED_2_STR         "9"

#define GPIO_WAN_LED                10
#if (defined AC1450)
#define GPIO_WIFI_5G_LED            11
#else
#define GPIO_WIFI_2G_LED            9
#define GPIO_WIFI_5G_LED            11

/* Interface definitions */
#define WAN_IF_NAME_NUM             "eth0"
#define LAN_IF_NAME_NUM             "vlan1"
#define WLAN_IF_NAME_NUM            "eth1"
#define WLAN_N_IF_NAME_NUM          "eth2"
#define WDS_IF_NAME_NUM             "wds0.1"  /* WDS */
[[Category:English Documentation]]
